description: "When you go out there and you're faced with those conditions, you've got to crack on and deal with it," Stokes said after England ended a 15-year wait for a Test win on Australian soil. Smith said the pitch had too much grass, which created excessive seam movement and made batting difficult.

title: Message for Cong? Digvijaya shares old photo of Modi at RSS event - what he said
description: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh praised the RSS's organizational strength, highlighting how grassroots workers rise to leadership. He later clarified his support for 'sangathan' (organization) but remained opposed to the RSS and Prime Minister Modi. Singh also urged Rahul Gandhi to implement internal reforms within the Congress, drawing parallels with his push for Election Commission reforms.

description: Rabindranath Tagore's patriotic song, 'Jana Gana Mana' was sung publicly for the first time at a 1911 Congress session. It ultimately evolved into becoming India's National Anthem. Initially met with controversy regarding its inspiration, Tagore clarified it honored a timeless guiding spirit, not a monarch. Adopted in 1950 as the national anthem, "Jana Gana Mana" became a unifying national voice.

Medical bodies are backing the doctor, demanding his reinstatement and a fair inquiry.

description: England secured a crucial four-wicket victory in the fourth Ashes Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, marking their first win on Australian soil in 15 years. description: A 25-year-old Bangladeshi national, Rayhan Kabir, was arrested in Basirhat, India, after illegally crossing the border to meet a woman he met on social media. He was apprehended by locals due to suspicious behavior and subsequently detained by police for failing to produce valid documents. Kabir has been remanded in judicial custody for 14 days as investigations continue.

title: What to do with house & car in US while stuck in India waiting for H-1B approval?
Between two Indias: Life on the 2025 feed
description: In 2025, the Indian "scroll" is a journey through two worlds on one screen: a filtered India of aesthetic luxury and a raw India of everyday labor. As affordable data and smartphones bring 500 million users online—mostly from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities—the distance between these lives has collapsed.

title: Elliotte Friedman warns Maple Leafs face tough talks amid inconsistency
description: The Toronto Maple Leafs are going through a rough patch with inconsistent performances and growing pressure on leadership. Elliotte Friedman has said the team needs to act quickly to improve consistency and accountability. How the Leafs play in the coming games will show if they can get back on track and avoid a difficult stretch this season.

title: Brittany Mahomes shifts focus as Patrick Mahomes earns praise off the field
description: NFL titans Robert Kraft and Gayle Benson, both billionaires, showcase contrasting paths to sports ownership. Kraft built a vast empire through diverse investments before acquiring the Patriots, while Benson inherited and expanded her late husband's franchises, the Saints and Pelicans. Their financial journeys highlight distinct strategies for wealth accumulation and franchise management.

title: Google CEO shares AI-made Xmas photo: Elon Musk reacts; post goes viral
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai's AI-generated Christmas greeting featuring himself and his dog, Jeffree, in a custom snow globe image, garnered significant attention on X.

title: 'Save us, open borders': Hindus send SOS from B'desh; attacks on minorities rising
description: Hindus in Bangladesh are pleading with India to open its borders, fearing escalating violence and persecution following recent lynchings.  Concerns are heightened by the potential return of a hardline BNP leader, with minorities feeling trapped and vulnerable.  Activists criticize Indian Hindu organizations for inaction, warning of a potential 'holocaust' if borders remain closed.

title: Frank Lampard & Christine Lampard net worth 2025: Football, TV success
description: Former Chelsea star Frank Lampard, a decorated player and manager, has achieved significant success in football. His wife, Christine Lampard, is a highly recognized and versatile TV presenter. Despite their public profiles, the couple prioritizes their children, maintaining a combined net worth estimated at £100 million through their respective careers and investments.
